channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: More of the same with commercial waste added, 1st August
item.description:
The first 2 photos are the afternoon immediately after bin/recycling collection The 3rd photo shows the mass that has collected since. The pile includes cardboard from the local take away / restaurant which has no problem dumping their commercial waste This area was supposed to be monitored Not sure what kind of monitoring this is

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Trinity Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree, 1st August
item.description:
Hi. I live in London Road SE23 3XW. We have huge very overgrown abandoned trees that need pruning. I'm very concerned the fact that no one s taking responsibility for this. On the council website says it’s tfl responsibility, on tfls website it says it’s not their responsibility but fix my street. How can such a huge tree be no one’s responsibility? I have seen my neighbours reporting these tree problems as the roots are breaking the front gardens of our property and the buses are getting hit with the branches and also the tree is so big it's more than half way through the street. But tfl doesn't want to deal with it it says you can help ? I'm extremely concerned therefore you my council I hope can get in touch with the right department and advise who is meant to deal with this before someone gets hurt

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, London Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Un emptied bins from No. 26, 1st August
item.description:
I don’t know exactly why the bin men are refusing to collect the bins from no 26. Everyday the foxes rip open their bins and rubbish is over the street constantly. I’m forever having to talk to them to clean up their rubbish and to give them some credit they always do! Can you please empty their bins as a matter of urgency!!! Can you also educate the tenants on how to properly dispose of their waste so this does not continue! Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coxwell Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all along wall plumstead common road, 1st August
item.description:

item.title: 133-135 plumstead common road, 1st August
item.description:
Right next to the bus stop. One of the properties here has dumped several black bags (?!) Of garden waste on the public pavement. Obstruction and eye sore, spilling out and attracting further littering

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Rubbish spilled over pavement, 1st August
item.description:
Apparently the residents of 187-189 Plumstead common road have been told by the council to leave there flimsy black bin bags and rubbish on the pavement for collection. Well, they have been torn open leaving all sorts on the street. See photo with my child - this is my daily reality of living around Plumstead common. Can't even take them to the common anymore due to the amount of rubbish. It is disgusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 187, Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent littering &fly tipping near post office, 1st August
item.description:
From post office to the housing estate there is persistent littering and fly tipping. Outside post office people drop the cash machine receipts on the floor. There is are several bags of rubble on the pavement attracting rubbish. When I asked the post office proprietor he said they were his and he's not moving them. They are on a public footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9-15, Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a large steel ladder next to my house behind the bushes, 1st August
item.description:
There is a large steel ladder next to my building. This is a little concerning, as I often leave the small windows on my second floor open. There is also a lot of other rubbish behind the bush and it seems to be have become a dumping ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-32, Palace Square, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
